None of them offers quick money. If you want quick money you probably should look into going into trading and that will require you to acquire certain knowledge like how to analyze market movement and also which coins or token will do well in a certain period of time. The main point of my post is that you have to be knowledgeable before you can make decent amount from Bitcoin or crypto but for now you can just purchase some Bitcoin to hodl if you have some cash to spare. comments.body: The only true decentralized cryptocurrency you will ever come across is Bitcoin. comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, you write that you want to know where to invest your money and get a quick profit. You must be careful. Because just such people in a hurry, who do not read and do not seek to learn something on their own, are hunted by scammers. They can write you a letter personally and promise a very quick profit if you invest a certain amount in an account that a scammer will offer you. Or people like you will fall for the bait on social media.To prevent this from happening, you need to educate yourself so that you clearly understand what is Bitcoin and what is an "altcoin," since you do not understand the difference at all. Do not plan anything until you understand all the necessary things.

comments.author: HajiBagi
comments.body: While investing in both is not a bad idea, I will recommend bitcoin because, despite the fact that all decentralized digital currencies have drawbacks, bitcoin is good for the future and you are aware that investing in any cryptocurrency activity does not automatically mean you have succeeded. All you need to know is that you either sell and make a profit or lose money when you do so, so I would like you to learn more about bitcoin before you start investing.

comments.author: wajik-tempe
comments.body: Hi, first of all welcome to the forum  Regardless of which cryptocurrency you choose to invest in, it's important to understand that investing in the cryptocurrency market is a high-risk investment and should only be done with money you can afford to lose.Bitcoin is often considered the most established and widely recognized cryptocurrency, and it has a long history of price appreciation. However, the value of Bitcoin can be subject to large swings in a short period of time, and it may not be suitable for all investors.Altcoins could be your options such as Ethereum, Ripple, or Litecoin, can provide exposure to the broader cryptocurrency market and may offer diversification benefits. Also these cryptocurrencies are also subject to high volatility and have a lower market capitalization compared to Bitcoin.Don't find something that offers quick profit because it will trap you at the end.

Well in your statement above, "wanna invest my money on decentralized digital currency", if its a decentralized currency then I propose you go for a bitcoin investment and that would be a long term investment because an investment in bitcoin doesn't pump up overnight just like that so even after investing you will have to wait and hold your coins for some time to get at least some tangible profit added to your investment capital. Although their some altcoins which you can invest and your profits can pump up real fast but the risk of knowing and choosing the right altcoins is always there.
